intro: Cryptantha mariposae, commonly known as the Mariposa cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly in California. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It produces small, cylindrical seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Cryptantha mariposae is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub habitats.
